data.title: Upacara Ngaben
data.short_description: Ngaben ceremony is part of the teachings of Hinduism. This tradition aims to purify the spirits of the dead

data.title: Gebug Ende Seraya
data.short_description: Gebug Ende is done by fighting two people. Each carries a weapon in the form of a rattan and a protector

data.title: Upacara Mekare-kare
data.short_description: Mekare-kare ceremony is a Balinese tradition of ritual combat with clubs made of pandan.

data.title: Upacara Mepandes
data.short_description: Mepandes ceremony is a form of ritual for adolescents, typically teenagers, that involves the filing of the canine teeth.

data.title: Tari Legong
data.short_description: Legong is characterized by intricate finger movements, complicated footwork, and expressive gestures and facial expressions.

data.title: Tari Kecak
data.short_description: Kecak dance is based on the story of the Ramayana and is traditionally performed in temples and villages across Bali.

data.title: Tari Janger
data.short_description: Janger dance is a traditional dance from Bali that tells a story of someone who is madly in love (infatuated).

data.title: Tari Pendet
data.short_description: Pendet dance is a traditional dance from Bali that is performed as a prelude to ceremonies or other dances.

data.title: Betutu
data.short_description: Betutu is an Balinese dish of steamed or roasted chicken or duck in rich bumbu betutu (betutu spice mix)

data.title: Lawar
data.short_description: Lawar is a Balinese dish created from a mixture of vegetables, coconut and minced meat mixed with rich herbs and spices.

data.title: Tipat Cantok
data.short_description: Tipat Cantok is a Balinese dish made of various boiled or blanched vegetables with ketupat rice cake, served in spicy peanut sauce.

data.title: Laklak
data.short_description: Laklak is Balinese traditional little pancake with grated coconut and melted palm sugar.
